short_meta: InventEd aims to improve how material is taught and learned, starting with schools in Israel and with the potential to scale worldwide. The app provides a structured way for teachers to manage groups, create tasks, and conduct interactive lessons while giving students a clear and engaging platform to participate in class.

teacher_side.description: Upload an Excel file (e.g., from Mashov) with student details, automatically extracting information and saving it into the database.
View all existing groups and the students in each group.
Generate tasks using AI or by manual input. A task includes a subject, short description, and one or more questions.
Begin a lesson for a specific group. Within a lesson, select one or more tasks for students to solve.
View live participation, task progress, and results in real time.

student_side.description: See all groups the student belongs to (e.g., Math, Computer Science).
Students see when a teacher has opened a lesson and can join it.
When joining a lesson, mark presence or absence (MVP can skip this if needed).
Answer the questions the teacher has assigned during the lesson.
Access completed lessons and personal results.

shared.description: Users log in with their Personal ID. They also select their role (Teacher/Student) to be redirected to the correct interface.

teacher_scenarios.scenario_name: From Login to Running a Lesson (New Teacher)
steps: The teacher logs in using their Personal ID and selects “Teacher.”
They are redirected to the teacher dashboard.
They click Groups → Create New Group.
They give the group a name and upload an Excel file with student details.
The group is created and saved in the database.
They return to the dashboard and click Create Task.
They enter a task title, a short description, and either manually enter or generate 10 multiple-choice questions with AI.
The task is saved in the database.
They go back to the dashboard and click Start Lesson.
They select the group they just created.
All students in that group now see an active lesson.
Students join the lesson and mark attendance (optional for MVP).
The teacher assigns the task created earlier.
Students answer the task questions.
After submission, the teacher sees analytics: Which students are struggling, Who is performing well, Class averages.
The teacher continues with more tasks if desired.
At the end of class, the lesson is saved under “Past Lessons” for both teacher and students.
Teacher logs in and navigates to their groups.
Selects a group and opens the Past Lessons tab.
Reviews detailed analytics for a previous lesson: Student participation rates, Scores per task, Overall class performance trends.
Uses this data to plan future lessons.

student_scenarios.scenario_name: Joining and Solving a Lesson (New Student)
steps: The student logs in with their Personal ID and selects “Student.”
They are redirected to the student dashboard.
They see their active groups (e.g., Math, CS).
They notice an active lesson in Math and click Join Lesson.
They are prompted to mark attendance (optional for MVP).
They wait until the teacher starts a task.
The task appears on their screen. They answer all questions.
For example, they answer 10 questions but only get 4/10 correct.
Their results are submitted.
After the lesson, they can go to Past Lessons and review their score.
Student logs in and goes to the dashboard.
Selects a group and opens the Past Lessons tab.
Sees a list of lessons they’ve participated in.
Clicks into one lesson to review: Which questions they got right or wrong, Their overall score.
Uses this to understand where they need to improve.

why_it_matters: InventEd provides teachers with a powerful but simple way to manage classes and lessons, while giving students a clear, structured, and engaging experience. The focus is on ease of use, immediate feedback, and actionable analytics that can improve teaching outcomes and learning results.
